text: (Post v1) Anything that's not breaking (major) and not a bugfix (patch) I put as minor :)

elements.text: (Post v1) Anything that's not breaking (major) and not a bugfix (patch) I put as minor :)

text: But I don't think anyone would mind if it was a patch. That said, anyone allowing only patch updates to the version they're using probably wants to be very conservative. So maybe that's a reason for minor. And I do think it's worth making a release for any change to src, if only for the sake of making bugs easier to track down.

elements.text: But I don't think anyone would mind if it was a patch. That said, anyone allowing only patch updates to the version they're using probably wants to be very conservative. So maybe that's a reason for minor. And I do think it's worth making a release for any change to src, if only for the sake of making bugs easier to track down.

text:
My belief in releasing after every nonbreaking PR only grows. Today once again managed to track down a bug super quickly because there was only a single PR that could have caused it.
(Today's bug was a silly mistake easily fixed, but the last few times this has happened has been in FiniteDifferences.jl where finding out why your accuracy dropped from `1e-14` to `1e-12` is *hard )*
